result.execSummary:
The defendant Jama A Kileyte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA and DV surcharges and restitution if ordered.  Bail on deposit, if any, to apply.  Remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Victim was notified. 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA and DV surcharges and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Prisicilla W.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26214417 in court 1x on 10/26/15.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D279
cf

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
.
Jury continued to deliberate at 1:15 p.m...
.
Jury back in box.
 At the hour of 1:25 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson, Terrence B.  brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.    Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Jury out of box.  The court had denied a motion by the defense to remove the penalty enhancer yesterday.  The court has reconsidered its decision and ordered the penalty enhancer, "While Armed" dismissed.
.  
Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror Janine K. selected by lot.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:20 a.m. to deliberate in charge of Deputy Sheriffs Pamela Terrell and Scott Krueger who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
.
Court adjourned the case for the lunch hour.....
.

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  01:58 p.m..  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause and who were duly impaneled and sworn at 2:55 p.m..  Jury list received and filed.
.
Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statement by state.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Priscilla W.  Exhibit 2 received.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officers, James Klusman. Exhibits 3 -7 received.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer, Richard Fredericks.  Exhibit 9 received.  State recalled Milwaukee Police Officer, James Klusmann.  State rests. 
Opening statement by the Defense.  Sworn for the Defense:  The defendant, Jama Kileyte.  State and Defense rests.  
Jury out of box.   Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Defense motion to dismiss the penalty enhancer "While Armed" is denied by the court.  
.
The court will adjourn for the evening and instructed to return to court in the morning no later than 9:15 a.m.

ADA Owen Piotrowski appears for that state of Wisconsin.  Atty Odalo Ohiku appears with the defendant.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Due to in custody case proceeding to trial, the court will spin this case to another court for trial today.
Parties are advised that Judge Konkol is available and willing to hear this matter today.    Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  The court will look for another court to hear this case today if possible.  Court directs parties to return at 1:30pm.
Felony Coordinator contacts the court after parties have left and informs the court that Judge Kremers is available and will hear the case this afternoon.
Case is sent to Branch 36 forthwith.
Jury trial scheduled for 10-26-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.  Cases are joined for purposes of trial.  Court orders case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 4.  

Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Case 2015CM1039 and 2015CM1543.  The State will provide defense counsel with a global offer.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-1-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defendant picked up a new case (2015CM1543), upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-12-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Lachese W., Tammie W., or Priscilla W., no weapons and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lachese W., Tammie W., and Priscilla W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jama A Kileyte in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/31/15 @ 1:30 pm
